perturbation.original_text: This amendment to Section 2 (titled "Term"), Part B of the Co-Branding Agreement is made effective December 9, 1996 by and between PC Quote, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "PCQ") and A.B. Watley, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "ABW"), who are also the parties contracted in the aforementioned Co-Branding Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: This amendment to Section 2 (titled "Term"), Part B of the Co-Branding Agreement is made effective December 9, 1996 by and between PC Quote, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "PCQ") and A.B. Watley, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "ABW"), who are also the parties contracted in the aforementioned Co-Branding Agreement. This amendment is only effective if ratified by a majority vote of PCQ's shareholders.
perturbation.explanation: The added sentence contradicts the initial statement by introducing a condition for the amendment's effectiveness (shareholder ratification) that wasn't initially present. This creates uncertainty about when the amendment actually takes effect.

perturbation.original_text: This Amendment shall apply to said PCQ and ABW and all of their subsidiaries and related companies.
perturbation.changed_text: This Amendment shall apply to said PCQ and ABW. Application to their subsidiaries and related companies is subject to individual written agreements.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the amendment applies to subsidiaries and related companies automatically. The modified text introduces the need for individual written agreements for those entities, contradicting the automatic application. This creates confusion on which entities are bound by the amendment.

Mr. Steven Malin Mr. Howard Meltzer Director President Date: 12/5/96 Date: 12/12/96  However, this agreement is non-binding, and merely serves as a memorandum of understanding.
